text:
Beyoncé Knowles-Carter turns 37 on Tuesday, and her fans around the world are paying tribute to their Queen Bey.

Kicking off the well-wishes was Beyoncé's mother Tina Lawson, who shared a touching tribute on social media. She posted a photo of four-months-old Beyoncé on Instagram, professing her love for her eldest daughter.

"...the day that you and your sister entered this world were the two best days of my life, hands down !! It is a privilege to have carried you two in this body ❤️ Enjoy your B-Day !!! No one deserves it more !! I love you Mom," she wrote.

Ms. Tina wishes Beyoncé a happy birthday on Instagram. 💖 #BeyDay #HappyBirthdayBeyoncé pic.twitter.com/jf7hmbpfbl

— BEYONCÉ LEGION (@BeyLegion) September 4, 2018

Messages of love continued pouring in with the hashtag Bey Day.

On this day 37 years ago God herself took human form in Beyoncé Giselle Knowles-Carter. As the BeyHive we celebrate BeyDay for all the blessing our queen constantly gives us. We thank you and honour you on this day. Can the BeyHive say AMEN? pic.twitter.com/fKCaGkbiOj

— Simply Jamal 🏳️‍🌈 (@JamalDeanG) September 4, 2018

Happy 37th birthday to our queen @Beyonce❤️🧡💛💚💙💜 #BeyDay pic.twitter.com/sjJa0m0Nn4

— Reggie 👑 (@Infinite67) September 4, 2018

the queen's day today!! pic.twitter.com/LODrIcT8wl

— 𝓷𝓸𝓻𝓶𝓪𝔂𝓸𝓷𝓬𝓮²⁰¹⁸ 🤸🏽‍♀️ (@shspooked) September 4, 2018

Happy Birthday to a PIONEER, the greatest entertainer of our time and ONE of THE BIGGEST artists to ever grace the music industry! #BeyDay #HappyBirthdayBeyoncé pic.twitter.com/lOUSFoaiw4

— BEYONCÉ STATS (@BeyStats) September 4, 2018

#HappyBirthdayBeyoncé! Thanks for being such an inspiration to us all. We really love and appreciate you! ❤️ pic.twitter.com/I8BjWnh257

— Beyoncé Releases (@BeyReleases) September 4, 2018

#HappyBirthdayBeyonce

The best performer alive and also the prettiest woman I've ever seen 😭💖 pic.twitter.com/cNhcZ9KL8Q

— M (@fiutl) September 3, 2018

To celebrate Beyonce's special day, the organisers of the highly anticipated Global Citizens, taking place in South African on December 2, are offering two VIP tickets to the event.

It’s Beyoncé’s Birthday! 👑 To celebrate @glblctzn are offering the chance to earn 2 x VIP tickets to see her perform at Global Citizen Festival: Mandela 100 in Joburg. Hurry, this special chance ends tonight! #HappyBirthdayBeyoncé https://t.co/xAxFtITe51 pic.twitter.com/QcOAvtcQ1R

— Global Citizen Festival: Mandela 100 (@GCMandela100) September 4, 2018

The inaugural South African edition of the festival has a stellar line-up that includes Beyoncé, alongside Jay-Z, Pharrell Williams, Chris Martin, Ed Sheeran, Eddie Vedder and Usher as well as African heavyweights Tiwa Savage, D’Banj, Femi Kuti, Wizkid, Cassper Nyovest and Sho Madjozi.

Last year Jay-Z let his fans serenade Bey on her birthday at his Made in America festival.
